snippet: President Obama pointed to the Kremlin’s role in arming rebels in the area of the attack and referred to the events there as an “outrage of unspeakable proportions.”
abstract: United States government concludes that Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was shot down by Russian-made surface-to-air missile launched from rebel-held territory in Ukraine; weapon was likely provided by Russia to pro-Moscow separatists; Pres Obama addresses findings, laying blame on Kremlin and calling on international community to open its eyes to escalating pro-Russian insurgency in Ukraine that has become an international crisis.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER, MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David M. Herszenhorn from Kiev, Ukraine; Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow; Sabrina Tavernise from Grabovo, Ukraine; Ian Lovett from Los Angeles; Somini Sengupta at the United Nations; Melissa Eddy from Berlin; Alan Cowell from London; James Kanter from Brussels; Dan Bilefsky from Paris; and Michael S. Schmidt, Eric Schmitt, Michael D. Shear and Julie Davis from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama pointed to the Kremlin’s role in arming rebels in the area of the attack and referred to the events there as an “outrage of unspeakable proportions.”

headline.sub: Flight Path of Jet Over Combat Zone in Ukraine Questioned
headline.main: U.S. Sees Evidence of Russian Links to Jet’s Downing
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees Evidence of Russian Links to Jet’s Downing
